title: Health Data Integration Framework - Standardized API for Health Device Data Ingestion
justification: This subOption is crucial for John, as it supports his goal of ensuring compliance in digital health applications by enabling secure and standardized interactions with health devices. It aligns with his need for regulatory observability and interoperability, which are integral to managing compliance risks.
subOption: Standardized API for health device data ingestion

title: Health Monitoring Alerts System – User-Customizable Alert Preferences
justification: This capability aligns with John's goal of promoting adaptable system behavior that respects individual user preferences and privacy boundaries. Customizable alert preferences would enable users to tailor notifications to their specific needs, ensuring compliance with user consent and enhancing the overall user experience.

title: Telehealth Integration – EHR Integration for Compliance and Auditability
justification: This capability is crucial for John as it supports his goal of ensuring compliance by facilitating proper tracking and management of patient data, which aligns with his focus on legal audit-readiness and ensuring compliance-by-design principles in digital health applications.

title: Medication Management Interface – Caregiver Notification for Missed Doses
justification: This subOption aligns with John's goal of ensuring compliance by enhancing the traceability and accountability of medication management, thereby supporting the broader objective of maintaining user safety and health. It also allows for real-time monitoring, which is crucial for compliance and risk management.

title: User Health History Access - Secure Access Controls for Sensitive Information
justification: Given John's role in compliance and risk management, ensuring secure access controls for sensitive health information is critical for maintaining privacy and regulatory standards, aligning with his goal of creating compliant and user-centric experiences.
subOption: Secure access controls for sensitive information

title: Open API Ecosystem - Backward Compatible API Versioning for Compliance
justification: This capability is crucial for John as it ensures that new applications developed for the ALFRED system can maintain compatibility with existing services, which aligns with his goal of ensuring compliance and reducing long-term risk in application development.
subOption: API versioning support for backward compatibility

title: Comprehensive Developer Documentation - Step-by-Step Integration Guides for Compliance
justification: This subOption is crucial for John as it aligns with his goal of ensuring compliance-by-design principles and helping engineers create consistent privacy policy language. Clear integration guides will enable developers to build compliant applications efficiently without misinterpretations of legal requirements.

title: Security and Privacy Controls - User Consent Management Interfaces
justification: User consent management is crucial for John to ensure that applications comply with data privacy standards and facilitate transparent interactions within the ALFRED system. This aligns with his goal of promoting adaptable system behavior that respects individual user preferences and privacy boundaries.

title: Developer Support and Community Engagement – Regular Webinars and Q&A Sessions
justification: John's goals emphasize the importance of scalable learning and staying aligned with industry trends, making regular webinars and Q&A sessions vital for sharing best practices and compliance strategies across teams. This aligns with his need for ongoing education and collaboration within the developer community.

title: Modular Extension Architecture - Plugin-Based System for Compliance-Driven Development
justification: A plugin-based system aligns with John's goal of ensuring compliance-by-design principles, as it allows developers to create applications that can be easily integrated while adhering to compliance standards. This modularity supports adaptability and scalability, enabling compliance checks to be built into the development process without becoming a bottleneck.
subOption: Plugin-based system for adding new features

title: Performance Monitoring Tools – API Usage Analytics Dashboard
justification: John's role as a Compliance and Risk Lead emphasizes the need for monitoring and oversight of system interactions, particularly with API usage that must comply with regulatory standards. An analytics dashboard would provide essential insights into API interactions, helping ensure compliance and security across the ALFRED platform.
subOption: Analytics dashboard for API usage statistics

title: Interoperability with Third-Party Services - Integration Templates for Compliance-Aware Development
justification: This subOption supports John's goal of ensuring compliance-by-design principles by providing developers with a structured way to integrate applications while adhering to regulatory standards. It aligns with his need for clear, reusable documentation and helps mitigate compliance challenges during development.
subOption: Integration templates for common use cases
